definition: to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)
to conform to no conventional pattern/unconventional/offbeat

sentences.english: Stereotypes and caricatures also exist about occupations or professions .
sentences.chinese: 對於職業，也存在着俗套和漫畫式的認識。

sentences.english: In this, the Tennessee Senator follows a  well-worn  rhetorical path.
sentences.chinese: 這位田納西參議員選擇了一條俗套的路線。

sentences.english: Whose would be man , must be a nonconformist .
sentences.chinese: 任何一個真正的人都肯定是不落俗套的人。

sentences.english: The movie was good despite its formulaic plot.
sentences.chinese: 該電影情節雖然落入俗套，但還算是部好電影。

sentences.english: But my real problem with the speech, on matters economic, was its conventionality.
sentences.chinese: 但我對這一演說中有關經濟的真正失望是它的俗套。

sentences.english: TV shows based on old classics can often end up falling flat.
sentences.chinese: 翻拍經典老片而成的電視劇經常會落進平庸與俗套。

sentences.english: Spontaneity is one of the key elements of creativity.
sentences.chinese: 自發性，不落俗套就是創造性中最關鍵的因素。

sentences.english: What I specially like about the oil-painting is its originality.
sentences.chinese: 我特別喜歡這幅油畫的地方是它不落俗套。

sentences.english: China’s record as a citizen of the world is strikingly threadbare.
sentences.chinese: 中國作爲世界公民的記錄俗套得驚人。

sentences.english: Maybe at last I am the most vulgar love quality.
sentences.chinese: 可能我的愛情就是最終落入俗套的那種。

sentences.english: The court documents read like a cliché-filled movie script.
sentences.chinese: 庭審文件讀起來就像是俗套的電影劇本。

definition: to conform to no conventional pattern/unconventional/offbeat
to stir up emotion/to arouse sympathy/moving
silly talk or "mo lei tau" (Cantonese), genre of humor emerging from Hong Kong late in the 20th century
to act cleverly to get what one desires/to get the best at least expense
